definition: tied up in a bundle on a high shelf/to put sth on the back burner/no longer a high priority
surname Shu
to bind/bunch/bundle/classifier for bunches, bundles, beams of light etc/to control
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
high/tall/above average/loud/your (honorific)
surname Gao
pavilion (usu. two-storied)/cabinet (politics)/boudoir/woman's chamber/rack/shelf

sentences.english: The  selfish man put himself on the  shelf.
sentences.chinese: 那个自私的人把自己束之高阁。

sentences.english: I steeled myself against thoughts of my father.
sentences.chinese: 我把和父亲有关的想法都束之高阁。

sentences.english: We'll have to put this conspiracy theory back on the shelf.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我们得把阴谋论束之高阁了。

sentences.english: But being pigeonholed as a gay film actor is kind of weird for me.
sentences.chinese: 但作为一个同志电影演员是很怪的我束之高阁。

sentences.english: Various proposals to fix the deficit look set to gather dust (see article).
sentences.chinese: 各种解决赤字问题的提案看上去将束之高阁。

sentences.english: and you're just ready to throw it all to the floor and forget about it.
sentences.chinese: 你们已经准备就此打住，把这事束之高阁了。

sentences.english: I hope this time they will not put my plan on the shelf.
sentences.chinese: 希望这一次他们不会把我的计划束之高阁。

sentences.english: The idea of a short project with 15 photographs was rapidly shelved.
sentences.chinese: 只有15张照片的简短计划这种想法很快被束之高阁。

definition: to toss away like a pair of worn-out shoes (idiom)
to throw away like worn out shoes
to take as a guiding principle (idiom)
useless/worthless
to value the broom as one's own (idiom); to attach value to sth because it is one's own/a sentimental attachment
to treat as/to regard as/to look upon as
to announce to the world (idiom)/to make public/to let everyone know
lit. to decorate the front of one's store (idiom)/fig. to embellish (one's CV, etc)/to keep up appearances/to put up a front
to pass into oblivion
to apply to/to put into (practice etc)/to put to (a test, a vote etc)
to engulf/to bury/to overlook/to stifle/to neglect/to fall into oblivion
dull and insipid
to drop (subject etc)
to be of no interest to anyone (idiom)
to regard like a pair of worn-out shoes/to look on sth as worthless
flower but no fruit (idiom); handsome exterior but hollow inside/flashy
